intro: Oxyspora setosa, commonly known as the hairy oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive appearance. Oxyspora setosa is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges.
